intro: Asarina stricta, commonly known as the slender asarina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with four petals and a tubular corolla. Asarina stricta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
